item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle: The Order of Giants DLC coming September
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-the-order-of-giants-dlc-coming-september

If you can't wait to crack the whip for another round with everyone's favourite fedora wearing professor, I have good news. Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's DLC - The Order of Giants - is set for release this autumn.

It is arriving on 4th September, across Xbox Series X/S, PS5 and PC.

As for what this DLC will be about, it is set during the events of the main game, and takes place in Rome. The DLC will feature "stunning new locations, intricate puzzles, terrifying new foes and more", with the developer mentioning Indy will have to do what he can to "outwit a dangerous cult" while uncovering "the dark legacy of the Nephilim giants".

You can check out a trailer for it all below.

"One of the most satisfying parts of developing Indiana Jones and the Great Circle was the opportunity to create the Nephilim Order, the secret society of giants formed by descendants of fallen angels working to atone for their ancestral sins," said production director John Jennings.

"That story spans thousands of years and this DLC has given us the opportunity to develop further upon their lore and look at other aspects not covered in the initial story campaign. There's something new and unexpected to tell here for fans of the game, and we can't wait for people to be able to play it for themselves."

Elsewhere this evening, Xbox again confirmed Hollow Knight Silksong will release this year, but alas, we still don't have a firm date.

item.title: Bloober's Cronos: The New Dawn gets release window
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/bloobers-cronos-the-new-dawn-gets-release-window

Hopefully in time for Halloween.

Bloober's next game, Cronos: The New Dawn, will be released this autumn - presumably in time for Halloween.

The Polish studio's follow-up to Silent Hill 2 was shown at today's Xbox Games Showcase, though it will be released across Xbox Series X/S, PS5, and PC.

The news was accompanied by a new gameplay trailer you can watch below.

Cronos: The New Dawn is Bloober's first original survival horror game, taking heavy inspiration from its Silent Hill 2 remake as well as Resident Evil and Dead Space.

I had a preview of the game at this year's Game Developer Conference, where I got to see its unique merge mechanic. If enemies aren't properly killed they can merge with others to boost their abilities - it reminded me of the Crimson Heads from the GameCube Resident Evil remake.

The game's setting is inspired by inspired by the brutalist architecture of Krakow's Nowa Huta and is heavily influenced by sci-fi themes.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 gets October release date
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/ninja-gaiden-4-gets-october-release-date

Ninja Gaiden 4 will be released on 21st October this year, across Xbox Series X/S, PC, and PS5.

The game was first announced earlier this year at the Xbox Developer Direct with an autumn release date, but now we know specifically when it'll be available.

The game is a collaboration between Team Ninja and PlatinumGames, known for the Bayonetta games and more.

Ninja Gaiden 4 will follow the re-release of Ninja Gaiden 2 Black that shadow dropped during the Developer Direct.

This new game will feature a new protagonist alongside series icon Ryu Hayabusa. Earlier this year, I spoke to the developers about how the game's two protagonists will honour the series' legacy.

The new gameplay trailer, above, showed off plenty of frantic, gory action in a futuristic world. In all, it's typical Ninja Gaiden stuff.
